title: Eddie Jones on his England side - 'This is our do or die moment, I have found my 23 Samurai'
text:
Eddie Jones believes his ‘Samurai’ squad will come down the volcanic hills that surround their base near Oita to deliver a merciless performance against Australia on Saturday in what the head coach describes as a ‘do-or-die’ match.

Jones insists that his warriors are '23-strong with eight more hiding up there in the caves,’ a rallying cry of unity that fly-half, George Ford, is unlikely to take much consolation from after he was dropped to the bench for the second World Cup in succession for the crunch fixtures.

England, in fact, traded an in-form fly-half for another player for the third tournament running with Martin Johnson doing likewise with Toby Flood and Jonny Wilkinson in 2011.

The ploy...
description: Eddie Jones believes his ‘Samurai’ squad will come down the volcanic hills that surround their base near Oita to deliver a merciless performance against Australia on Saturday in what the head coach describes as a ‘do-or-die’ match.
